text: The 1989 LPGA Championship was held May 30 to June 2 at Jack Nicklaus Golf Center at Kings Island in Mason, Ohio, a suburb northeast of Cincinnati. Played on the Grizzly Course, this was the 35th edition of the LPGA Championship. Nancy Lopez shot a final round 66 (−6) for 274 (−14), three strokes ahead of runner-up Ayako Okamoto, the third It was the last of three major titles for Lopez; all came on the Grizzly Course at the LPGA Championship. It was the also the last LPGA Championship at Kings Island, which had hosted twelve consecutive championships since 1978.
